To obtain appropriate SMA samples for testing purposes.
Confirm that:
a. Sampling location was randomly selected following

.
    b. The acceptance sample consists of one plate sample at the randomly selected location.
c. A backup sample will consist of one plate sample located 2 ft towards the center of the mat from the acceptance sample.
d. Samples from each location were obtained from each sublot from the pavement following the procedures below

:
        o Plate Samples without a Mold
- Place the plate with wire attached at the designated location. If conditions on the project cause the plate to slip, drive a nail into the pavement and place the plate hole onto the nail.
- Extend the wire tightly beyond the edge of the paving width.
- After the mixture is placed, locate the plate by use of the wire.
- Raise the plate slightly for insertion of a pitchfork or a shovel that is narrower than the plate.
- Lift the plate and sample and place the entire sample into the sample container. Material remaining on the plate shall be removed and placed into the sample container.
- Immediately refill the sample hole with HMA.
o Plate Samples with a Mold
- Place the plate with wire attached at the designated location. If conditions on the project cause the plate to slip, drive a nail into the pavement and place the plate hole onto the nail.
- Extend the wire tightly beyond the edge of the paving width.
- After the mixture is placed, locate the plate by use of the wire.
- Push a clean mold, by means of a circular motion, down into the mixture directly over the plate. The mold shall not be pushed from side to side.
- Raise the mold and plate together, and insert a pitchfork, or a shovel that is narrower than the plate.
- Lift the mold and plate, being careful to keep the two components tightly together.
- Discard any excess material on top of the plate that is outside of the mold by scraping the material from the plate.
- Place the sample inside of the mold into the sample container. Material remaining on the plate shall be removed and placed into the sample container.
- Immediately refill the sample hole with HMA.
e. The obtained samples were reduced into the maximum specific gravity samples and the binder content and gradation samples following the procedures below

:
        o Reducing samples to testing size â€“ minimum weight
- Place the sample on a clean splitting board.
- Thoroughly mix the sample by turning the entire sample over a minimum of four times with a trowel or drywall taping knife.
- Recombine two diagonally opposite portions.

- Weigh the sample. If the sample does not meet the minimum weight (mass) required for the appropriate test method, set aside the sample, and repeat the second and third steps for the remaining two portions.
- Add the additional diagonally opposite portions to the original sample. Repeat this procedure until the minimum weight required is obtained.
- If the sample obtained in the fourth step is excessively large, the sample may be discarded. Repeat the second to fifth steps for the remaining two portions until the required weight is obtained.
